verses.verse: A Song <S%H7892><s%> of degrees <S%H4609><s%> of David. <S%H1732><s%> Lord, <S%H3068><s%> my heart <S%H3820><s%> is not haughty, <S%H1361><s%> nor <S%H3808><s%> my eyes <S%H5869><s%> lofty: <S%H7311><s%> neither <S%H3808><s%> do I exercise <S%H1980><s%> myself in great <S%H1419><s%> matters, <S%H1419><s%> or in things too high <S%H6381><s%> for me.

Surely <S%H518><s%> <S%H3808><s%> I have behaved <S%H7737><s%> and quieted <S%H1826><s%> myself, <S%H5315><s%> as a child that is weaned <S%H1580><s%> of his mother: <S%H517><s%> my soul <S%H5315><s%> is even as a weaned <S%H1580><s%> child.
Let Israel <S%H3478><s%> hope <S%H3176><s%> in the LORD <S%H3068><s%> from now on <S%H6258><s%> and for ever. <S%H5769><s%>
